intro: Lopima anglicana, commonly known as the English lopima, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters during the late spring to early summer. Lopima anglicana is typically found in moist meadows and along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
